title.narrative: 4.1 C4D-SOCIAL INCLUSION & SS

description.narrative: 104/001 By 2020, select Communication for Development (C4D) sector partners at national and sub-national level, have increased capacity to develop, coordinate, allocate resources for, and implement policies on C4D/SBCC with focus on community participation and engagement., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Hiv Prevention, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, an enhanced policy environment and national and sub-national systems are in place for the realization of child rights, with a focus on equity, guided by knowledge and evidence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 104/001 By 2020, select Communication for Development (C4D) sector partners at national and sub-national level, have increasedcapacity to develop, coordinate, allocate resources for, and implement policies on C4D/SBCC with focus on community participationand engagement.

description.narrative: Despite COVID-19 related challenges, a substantial level of C4D system strengthening interventions was accomplished. Under the Local Governance for Children social behaviour change communication component, Local Government Institutions capacities on community engagement were enhanced, resulting in the development of costed micro plans for the improvement of the well-being of the children jointly with their communities. C4D components were also integrated into all emergency/humanitarian and urban-specific plans.;The Joint UNICEF-University Grants Commission C4D Research Fellowship Programme was;completed;and findings are ready for dissemination | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
